"42306ad2cf4affc056ec5d043dcf6ed99e49d4ad", "additions": 12, "patch": "@@ -18,4 +18,16 @@ struct Log2 : mozilla::tl::CeilingLog2<N>\n };\n #define LOG2(N) Log2<N>::value\n \n+// Compare two addresses. Returns whether the first address is smaller (-1),\n+// equal (0) or greater (1) than the second address.\n+template<typename T>\n+int\n+CompareAddr(T* aAddr1, T* aAddr2)\n+{\n+  uintptr_t addr1 = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(aAddr1);\n+  uintptr_t addr2 = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(aAddr2);\n+\n+  return (addr1 > addr2) - (addr1 < addr2);\n+}\n+\n #endif", "changes": 12}, {"status": "modified", "deletions": 115, "raw_url": "https://github.com/mozilla/gecko-dev/raw/273538b95c46bac2638eacd4ffb61642b63aaa6f/memory/build/mozjemalloc.cpp", "blob_url": "https://github.com/mozilla/gecko-dev/blob/273538b95c46bac2638eacd4ffb61642b63aaa6f/memory/build/mozjemalloc.cpp", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/mozilla/gecko-dev/contents/memory/build/mozjemalloc.cpp?ref=273538b95c46bac2638eacd4ffb61642b63aaa6f", "filename": "memory/build/mozjemalloc.cpp", "sha": "d9989ffb309d51659a86dcc19d02ad9cb02de719", "additions": 112, "patch": "@@ -248,6 +248,118 @@ _mmap(void* addr, size_t length, int prot, int flags, int fd, off_t offset)\n #endif\n #endif\n \n+// ***************************************************************************\n+// Structures for chunk headers for chunks used for non-huge allocations.\n+\n+struct arena_t;\n+\n+// Each element of the chunk map corresponds to one page within the chunk.\n+struct arena_chunk_map_t\n+{\n+  // Linkage for run trees.  There are two disjoint uses:\n+  //\n+  // 1) arena_t's tree or available runs.\n+  // 2) arena_run_t conceptually uses this linkage for in-use non-full\n+  //    runs, rather than directly embedding linkage.\n+  RedBlackTreeNode<arena_chunk_map_t> link;\n+\n+  // Run address (or size) and various flags are stored together.  The bit\n+  // layout looks like (assuming 32-bit system):\n+  //\n+  //   ???????? ???????? ????---- -mckdzla\n+  //\n+  // ? : Unallocated: Run address for first/last pages, unset for internal\n+  //                  pages.\n+  //     Small: Run address.\n+  //     Large: Run size for first page, unset for trailing pages.\n+  // - : Unused.\n+  // m : MADV_FREE/MADV_DONTNEED'ed?\n+  // c : decommitted?\n+  // k : key?\n+  // d : dirty?\n+  // z : zeroed?\n+  // l : large?\n+  // a : allocated?\n+  //\n+  // Following are example bit patterns for the three types of runs.\n+  //\n+  // r : run address\n+  // s : run size\n+  // x : don't care\n+  // - : 0\n+  // [cdzla] : bit set\n+  //\n+  //   Unallocated:\n+  //     ssssssss ssssssss ssss---- --c-----\n+  //     xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx---- ----d---\n+  //     ssssssss ssssssss ssss---- -----z--\n+  //\n+  //   Small:\n+  //     rrrrrrrr rrrrrrrr rrrr---- -------a\n+  //     rrrrrrrr rrrrrrrr rrrr---- -------a\n+  //     rrrrrrrr rrrrrrrr rrrr---- -------a\n+  //\n+  //   Large:\n+  //     ssssssss ssssssss ssss---- ------la\n+  //     -------- -------- -------- ------la\n+  //     -------- -------- -------- ------la\n+  size_t bits;\n+\n+// Note that CHUNK_MAP_DECOMMITTED's meaning varies depending on whether\n+// MALLOC_DECOMMIT and MALLOC_DOUBLE_PURGE are defined.\n+//\n+// If MALLOC_DECOMMIT is defined, a page which is CHUNK_MAP_DECOMMITTED must be\n+// re-committed with pages_commit() before it may be touched.  If\n+// MALLOC_DECOMMIT is defined, MALLOC_DOUBLE_PURGE may not be defined.\n+//\n+// If neither MALLOC_DECOMMIT nor MALLOC_DOUBLE_PURGE is defined, pages which\n+// are madvised (with either MADV_DONTNEED or MADV_FREE) are marked with\n+// CHUNK_MAP_MADVISED.\n+//\n+// Otherwise, if MALLOC_DECOMMIT is not defined and MALLOC_DOUBLE_PURGE is\n+// defined, then a page which is madvised is marked as CHUNK_MAP_MADVISED.\n+// When it's finally freed with jemalloc_purge_freed_pages, the page is marked\n+// as CHUNK_MAP_DECOMMITTED.\n+#define CHUNK_MAP_MADVISED ((size_t)0x40U)\n+#define CHUNK_MAP_DECOMMITTED ((size_t)0x20U)\n+#define CHUNK_MAP_MADVISED_OR_DECOMMITTED                                      \\\n+  (CHUNK_MAP_MADVISED | CHUNK_MAP_DECOMMITTED)\n+#define CHUNK_MAP_KEY ((size_t)0x10U)\n+#define CHUNK_MAP_DIRTY ((size_t)0x08U)\n+#define CHUNK_MAP_ZEROED ((size_t)0x04U)\n+#define CHUNK_MAP_LARGE ((size_t)0x02U)\n+#define CHUNK_MAP_ALLOCATED ((size_t)0x01U)\n+};\n+\n+// Arena chunk header.\n+struct arena_chunk_t\n+{\n+  // Arena that owns the chunk.\n+  arena_t* arena;\n+\n+  // Linkage for the arena's tree of dirty chunks.\n+  RedBlackTreeNode<arena_chunk_t> link_dirty;\n+\n+#ifdef MALLOC_DOUBLE_PURGE\n+  // If we're double-purging, we maintain a linked list of chunks which\n+  // have pages which have been madvise(MADV_FREE)'d but not explicitly\n+  // purged.\n+  //\n+  // We're currently lazy and don't remove a chunk from this list when\n+  // all its madvised pages are recommitted.\n+  DoublyLinkedListElement<arena_chunk_t> chunks_madvised_elem;\n+#endif\n+\n+  // Number of dirty pages.\n+  size_t ndirty;\n+\n+  // Map of pages within chunk that keeps track of free/large/small.\n+  arena_chunk_map_t map[1]; // Dynamically sized.\n+};\n+\n+// ***************************************************************************\n+// Constants defining allocator size classes and behavior.\n+\n // Minimum alignment of non-tiny allocations is 2^QUANTUM_2POW_MIN bytes.\n #define QUANTUM_2POW_MIN 4\n \n@@ -520,16 +632,6 @@ struct extent_node_t\n   ChunkType chunk_type;\n };\n \n-template<typename T>\n-int\n-CompareAddr(T* aAddr1, T* aAddr2)\n-{\n-  uintptr_t addr1 = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(aAddr1);\n-  uintptr_t addr2 = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(aAddr2);\n-\n-  return (addr1 > addr2) - (addr1 < addr2);\n-}\n-\n struct ExtentTreeSzTrait\n {\n   static RedBlackTreeNode<extent_node_t>& GetTreeNode(extent_node_t* aThis)\n@@ -668,87 +770,8 @@ class AddressRadixTree\n // ***************************************************************************\n // Arena data structures.\n \n-struct arena_t;\n struct arena_bin_t;\n \n-// Each element of the chunk map corresponds to one page within the chunk.\n-struct arena_chunk_map_t\n-{\n-  // Linkage for run trees. "10d451c711ed31e300486340214044befc196039", "additions": 80, "patch": "@@ -574,6 +574,50 @@ struct ExtentTreeBoundsTrait : public ExtentTreeTrait\n   }\n };\n \n+// Describe size classes to which allocations are rounded up to.\n+// TODO: add large and huge types when the arena allocation code\n+// changes in a way that allows it to be beneficial.\n+class SizeClass\n+{\n+public:\n+  enum ClassType\n+  {\n+    Tiny,\n+    Quantum,\n+    SubPage,\n+  };\n+\n+  explicit inline SizeClass(size_t aSize)\n+  {\n+    if (aSize < small_min) {\n+      mType = Tiny;\n+      mSize = std::max(RoundUpPow2(aSize), size_t(1U << TINY_MIN_2POW));\n+    } else if (aSize <= small_max) {\n+      mType = Quantum;\n+      mSize = QUANTUM_CEILING(aSize);\n+    } else if (aSize <= bin_maxclass) {\n+      mType = SubPage;\n+      mSize = RoundUpPow2(aSize);\n+    } else {\n+      MOZ_MAKE_COMPILER_ASSUME_IS_UNREACHABLE(\"Invalid size\");\n+    }\n+  }\n+\n+  SizeClass& operator=(const SizeClass& aOther) = default;\n+\n+  bool operator==(const SizeClass& aOther) { return aOther.mSize == mSize; }\n+\n+  size_t Size() { return mSize; }\n+\n+  ClassType Type() { return "unsigned", "verified": false, "payload": null, "signature": null}, "message": "Bug 1413143: Make font inflation computation less lazy. r=bz,JanH\n\nThis makes it a bit more straight-forward to change the system font scale,\npreserving the sync MediaFeatureChanged event.\n\nThis also avoids notifying media queries when the shell is not initialized.\n\nIn particular, the patch in bug 1404545 allows calling MediaFeatureValuesChanged\non a still-initializing pres-shell. This is nasty, and all this initialization\norder is kind of a mess, but I'm not reworking it for now...\n\nAlso, this drops the invalidation of font-inflation when a doctype is added to\nthe document. action from main. This is useful for those actions for main which\n+ * require higher reliability, i.e. the action will not be lost in the case\n+ * that it gets sent before the main is ready to receive it. Conversely, any\n+ * actions allowed early are accepted to be ignorable or re-sendable.\n+ */\n+const queueEarlyMessageMiddleware = store => next => action => {\n+  if (store._receivedFromMain) {\n+    next(action);\n+  } else if (au.isFromMain(action)) {\n+    next(action);\n+    store._receivedFromMain = true;\n+    // Sending out all the early actions as main is ready now\n+    if (store._earlyActionQueue) {\n+      store._earlyActionQueue.forEach(next);\n+      store._earlyActionQueue = [];\n+    }\n+  } else if (EARLY_QUEUED_ACTIONS.includes(action.type)) {\n+    store._earlyActionQueue = store._earlyActionQueue || [];\n+    store._earlyActionQueue.push(action);\n+  } else {\n+    // Let any other type of action go through\n+    next(action);\n+  }\n+};\n+\n+/**\n  * initStore - Create a store and listen for incoming actions\n  *\n  * @param  {object} reducers An object containing Redux reducers\n  * @param  {object} intialState (optional) The Bug 1414287 is on file to do so and remove this hack.\r\n+\r\n+diff --git a/clang/lib/Driver/ToolChains/MSVC.cpp b/clang/lib/Driver/ToolChains/MSVC.cpp\r\n+--- "js/src/tests/ecma_6/Date/time-zone-2038-pst.js", "sha": "9ed1b51f0d2307015ec576b0b3b81a18107e770a", "additions": 59, "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,59 @@\n+// |reftest| skip-if(!xulRuntime.shell)\n+\n+// Note: The default time zone is set to PST8PDT for all jstests (when run in the shell).\n+\n+assertEq(/^(PST|PDT)$/.test(getTimeZone()), true);\n+\n+const Month = {\n+    January: 0,\n+    February: 1,\n+    March: 2,\n+    April: 3,\n+    May: 4,\n+    June: 5,\n+    July: 6,\n+    August: 7,\n+    September: 8,\n+    October: 9,\n+    November: 10,\n+    December: 11,\n+};\n+\n+// U.S. daylight saving rules changed in 2007, excerpt from tzdata's\n+// northamerica file:\n+// NAME  FROM  TO    IN   ON       AT    SAVE  LETTER/S   \n+// US    1967  2006  Oct  lastSun  2:00  0     S\n+// US    1967  1973  Apr  lastSun  2:00  1:00  D\n+// US    1974  only  Jan  6        2:00  1:00  D\n+// US    1975  only  Feb  23       2:00  1:00  D\n+// US    1976  1986  Apr  lastSun  2:00  1:00  D\n+// US    1987  2006  Apr  Sun>=1   2:00  1:00  D\n+// US    2007  max   Mar  Sun>=8   2:00  1:00  D\n+// US    2007  max   Nov  Sun>=1   2:00  0     S\n+\n+\n+// When 2040 is mapped to 1984, the old U.S. rules are applied, i.e. DST isn't\n+// yet observed on March 31. If mapped to 2012, the new U.S. rules are applied\n+// and DST is already observed, which is the expected behaviour.\n+// A similar effect is visible in November.\n+// NOTE: This test expects that 2012 and 2040 use the same DST rules. If this\n+//       ever changes, the test needs to be updated accordingly.\n+{\n+    let dt1 = new Date(2040, Month.March, 31);\n+    assertEq(dt1.toString(), \"Sat Mar 31 2040 00:00:00 GMT-0700 (PDT)\");\n+\n+    let dt2 = new Date(2040, Month.November, 1);\n+    assertEq(dt2.toString(), \"Thu Nov 01 2040 00:00:00 GMT-0700 (PDT)\");\n+}\n+\n+// 2038 is mapped to 2027 instead of 1971.\n+{\n+    let dt1 = new Date(2038, Month.March, 31);\n+    assertEq(dt1.toString(), \"Wed Mar 31 2038 00:00:00 GMT-0700 (PDT)\");\n+\n+    let dt2 = new Date(2038, Month.November, 1);\n+    assertEq(dt2.toString(), \"Mon Nov 01 2038 00:00:00 GMT-0700 (PDT)\");\n+}\n+\n+if (typeof reportCompare === \"function\")\n+    reportCompare(true, true);", "changes": 59}, {"status": "removed",            or move the items to.\n+ * @param {Boolean} doCopy Set to true to copy the items, false will move them\n+ *                         if possible.\n+ * @return {Array} Returns an array of created PlacesTransactions.\n+ */\n+async function getTransactionsForTransferItems(dataFlavor, items, insertionIndex,\n+                                               insertionParentGuid, doCopy) {\n+  let transactions = [];\n+  let index = insertionIndex;\n+\n+  for (let item of items) {\n+    if (index != -1 && item.itemGuid) {\n+      // Note: we use the parent from the existing bookmark as the sidebar\n+      // gives us an unwrapped.parent that is actually a query and not the real\n+      // parent.\n+      let existingBookmark = await PlacesUtils.bookmarks.fetch(item.itemGuid);\n+\n+      // If we're dropping on the same folder, then we may need to adjust\n+      // the index to insert at the correct place.\n+      if (existingBookmark && insertionParentGuid == existingBookmark.parentGuid) {\n+        if (index > existingBookmark.index) {\n+          // If we're dragging down, we need to go one lower to insert at\n+          // the real point as moving the element changes the index of\n+          // everything below by 1.\n+          index--;\n+        } else if (index == existingBookmark.index) {\n+          // This isn't moving so we skip it.\n+          continue;\n+        }\n+      }\n+    }\n+\n+    // If this is not a copy, check for safety that we can move the\n+    // source, otherwise report an error and fallback to a copy.\n+    if (!doCopy && !PlacesControllerDragHelper.canMoveUnwrappedNode(item)) {\n+      Components.utils.reportError(\"Tried to move an unmovable Places \" +\n+                                   \"node, reverting to a copy operation.\");\n+      doCopy = true;\n+    }\n+    transactions.push(\n+      PlacesUIUtils.getTransactionForData(item,\n+                                          dataFlavor,\n+                                          insertionParentGuid,\n+                                          index,\n+                                          doCopy));\n+\n+    if (index != -1 && item.itemGuid) {\n+      index++;\n+    }\n+  }\n+  return transactions;\n+}", "changes": 186}, {"status": "modified", "deletions": 0, "raw_url": action from main. This is useful for those actions for main which\n+ * require higher reliability, i.e. the action will not be lost in the case\n+ * that it gets sent before the main is ready to receive it. Conversely, any\n+ * actions allowed early are accepted to be ignorable or re-sendable.\n+ */\n+const queueEarlyMessageMiddleware = store => next => action => {\n+  if (store._receivedFromMain) {\n+    next(action);\n+  } else if (au.isFromMain(action)) {\n+    next(action);\n+    store._receivedFromMain = true;\n+    // Sending out all the early actions as main is ready now\n+    if (store._earlyActionQueue) {\n+      store._earlyActionQueue.forEach(next);\n+      store._earlyActionQueue = [];\n+    }\n+  } else if (EARLY_QUEUED_ACTIONS.includes(action.type)) {\n+    store._earlyActionQueue = store._earlyActionQueue || [];\n+    store._earlyActionQueue.push(action);\n+  } else {\n+    // Let any other type of action go through\n+    next(action);\n+  }\n+};\n+\n+/**\n  * initStore - Create a store and listen for incoming actions\n  *\n  * @param  {object} reducers An object containing Redux reducers\n  * @param  {object} intialState (optional) The
